title: Did President Museveni get his facts right about Uganda’s development?
subtitle: President Yoweri Museveni, in power since 1986, recently had a message for the people of Uganda: one of steady progress. But does the evidence support his claims?
author: africacheck.org

• None President Yoweri Museveni said Uganda’s economy had grown steadily since 1986, and adult literacy has risen.
• None His claim of 6.3% average economic growth since 1986 was correct, but two other claims about growth were either misleading or incorrect.
